title: National Assembly By-Election (Bahati Constituency No. 062) (Election Date and Time of Poll) Order, 2019
content:
Supplement to the Republic of Zambia Government 53
Gazette dated Friday, 1st March, 2019
GOVERNMENT OF ZAMBIA
STATUTORY INSTRUMENT NO. 16 OF 2019
The Electoral Process Act, 2016
(Act No. 35 of 2016)
The Electoral Process (General) Regulations, 2016
The National Assembly By-Election (Bahati
ConstituencyNo. 062) (Election Date and
Time of Poll) Order, 2019
WHEREAS in pursuance of Article 72 (8) of the Constitution, the Cap. 1
Speaker of the National Assembly has informed the Electoral
Commission of Zambia of the vacancy in respect of Bahati
Constituency No. 062 by reason of the expulsion of Hon. Harry
Kalaba, Member of Parliament for Bahati Constituency, from the
political party which sponsored the member for election to the
National Assembly, and the declaration by the Speaker of the
National Assembly of the vacancy of the Parliamentary seat of the
Bahati Constituency:
NOW THEREFORE, in exercise of the powers contained in Article
57(3) of the Constitution and Regulation 15 (1) of the Electoral Cap. 1
Process (General) Regulations, 2016, the following Order is made:
1. This Order may be cited as the National Assembly By- Title
Election (Bahati Constituency No. 062) (Election Date and Time
of Poll) Order, 2019.
2. A candidate for election as a Member of Parliament for Nomination
Bahati Constituency No. 062 shall lodge a nomination with the for election
Returning Officer on Thursday, 14th March, 2019, between 0900
hours and 1500 hours.
3. The campaign period shall commence on Thursday, 14th Campaign
March, 2019, at 1500 hours and close at 1800 hours on Wednesday, period
10th April, 2019.
Copies of this Statutory Instrument can be obtained from the Government Printer,
P.O. Box 30136, 10101, Lusaka, Price K4.00 each
54 Statutory Instruments 1st March, 2019
Election date 4. (1) The poll in the Constituency referred to in paragraph 2
and time of shall take place on Thursday, 11th April, 2019, between 0600 hours
poll
and 1800 hours.
(2) A poll shall not be taken in a Constituency if only one
candidate is validly nominated.
Made by the Electoral Commission of Zambia at Lusaka this
27th day of February, 2019.
JUSTICE E. E. CHULU,
Chairperson
A. C. NHEKAIRO,
Vice-Chairperson
JUSTICE C. S. MUSHABATI,
Member
E. J. SIKAZWE,
Member
A. D. SIMWINGA,
Member
LUSAKA
27th February, 2019
[EC.101/5/5 CONF.]
